questions.question_text:
You assign security roles to users in your company. The security roles contain one or more duty assignments.
The purchasing manager role must be able to view payment journals.
You need to edit the security configuration to meet the requirement.
What should you do?

discussion.content:
I believe A is the correct answer.
B. View payment journal transactions is a privilege NOT permission level.
C. CAN NOT assign the privilege to the user directly
D. CAN NOT assign the duty to the user.
A is the answer because it is clearly written that "Purchasing manager role must be able to" view. B, C, & D talks about "separate assignment" to user and not to the role.

Selected Answer: B
B. Edit the existing role and assign the View payment journal transactions permission level.

Explanation:

In Dynamics 365 Finance, security roles are typically configured by assigning permission levels (which contain duties) to roles.
Editing the existing role and assigning the "View payment journal transactions" permission level is the most straightforward and standard way to grant the necessary access to view payment journals.
You don't need to create a new privilege or a new security role for this specific requirement. Assigning the appropriate permission level to the role directly is the appropriate approach.

Selected Answer: A

questions.question_text:
A company implements Dynamics 365 Finance.
The company's purchasing agents must be able to create purchase orders for a first-time vendor.
All new vendor requests must be reviewed and approved by the accounts payable manager.
A workflow must send an email to the accounts payable manager and the senior accounts payable clerk notifying both when a vendor application is waiting for approval. The workflow must be configured to account for people changing job roles.
You need to configure the system to meet these requirements.
What should you do?

choices.F: On the Recipient tab, select Participant. Then, select the users for the accounts payable manager and the senior accounts payable clerk from the list.
choices.E: On the Recipient tab, select User. Then, select the role for vendor approval from the list.
choices.D: On the Recipient tab, select Workflow user. Then, select the user for purchasing agents from the list.
choices.A: On the Recipient tab, select Workflow user. Then, select the role for vendor approval from the list.
choices.C: On the Recipient tab, select User. Then, select the users for the accounts payable manager and the senior accounts payable clerk from the list.
choices.B: On the Recipient tab, select Participant. Then, select the role for vendor approval from the list.
